channel.title: City News: City Latest News, Metro City News Today and Headlines | Hindustan Times
channel.description: City News - Find latest and update news from popular Metro Cities of India. A list of News headlines from all local cities such as Noida, Delhi, Lucknow, Kolkata, Patna, Haryana, Punjab etc based on current affairs at hindustantimes.com, India's No.1 English News website.

item.title: Power cuts in Bengaluru till Thursday; See area list here
item.description: BESCOM has scheduled several works to be undertaken by the Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation this week, leading to fresh power cuts in many areas on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday till 4 pm.

item.title: 11 hurt as vehicles in ex-MP Pappu Yadav’s cavalcade collide
item.description: Pappu Yadav said the vehicles escorting him collided as an overloaded truck tried to overtake them while they were on their way from Bihar’s Saran to Buxar

item.title: When PM Modi exclaimed 'aiyyo' on meeting comedian 'Aiyyo Shraddha'
item.description: Comedian Shraddha, on Monday, shared a couple of pictures from her meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

item.title: West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose’s principal secretary relieved of her duties
item.description: Nandini Chakravorty was appointed as principal secretary to governor La Ganesan in August 2022 and she continued in that post after Bose took oath, replacing Ganesan, in November last year

item.title: Gang busted, 4 arrested for stealing paddy from Bihar godowns; traced to UP village
item.description: The gang from UP came to bordering Bihar villages, broke open the godowns at night and frisked the paddy in trucks

item.title: 'Namaskara Bengaluru': Smriti Mandhana after being acquired by RCB for ₹3.4 crore
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore broke the bank for India vice-captain Mandhana and bought the stylish batter at a whopping sum of INR 3.40 crore, the highest bid at the auction so far.

item.title: Elephant carcass found in Odisha’s Athgarh
item.description: The Odisha government, which has faced criticism over its failure in protecting the elephants, told the high court last month that it would set up fast track courts for speedy trial of wildlife offences

item.title: Gujarat ATS arrests 5 people for trying to extort ₹8 crore from retired IPS officer
item.description: The accused have been booked under sections 389 (putting a person in fear of accusation of offence in order to commit extortion) and 120B (criminal conspiracy) of the Indian Penal Code

item.title: Proposal to raze chapel for football ground expansion in Daman triggers protests
item.description: In a tweet on Sunday, Trinamool Congress Member of Parliament on Sunday criticised the proposed demolition

item.title: Pappu Yadav's convoy meets with accident on Arrah-Buxar highway: Report
item.description: Jan Adhikar Party chief Pappu Yadav said district party president Sunil Kumar and Dinesh Kumar have sustained injuries on their hands. While some leaders have sustained injuries on their chest, some have received injuries on their heads. Two Bihar Military Police jawans have also been injured.

item.title: Madhya Pradesh: MLA warns cop to ‘shut up’ as they scuffle over filing an FIR
item.description: A video of the police official, named Hemant Nayak, forcing to root out BJP MLA Rajesh Prajapati from the station's entrance, where he was protesting, has gone viral.

item.title: Fadnavis claims he formed govt in 2019 with Pawar's support. NCP chief says…
item.description: Sharad Pawar stoutly denied Fadnavis's claim and said he never though the senior BJP leader will base his assertion on falsehood

item.title: Delhiwale: Roomies, a portrait
item.description: Inside an unusual home

item.title: Players from region rake in the moolah at Women’s Premier League auction
item.description: A few days ago, 19-year-old Shafali had led India to the first ICC world title beating England in the final of the U-19 T20 World Cup in South Africa

item.title: Stage set for Amit Shah’s Karnal visit on Tuesday
item.description: The home minister Amit Shah will present the President’s Colour Award to the state police in a ceremony organised at the Haryana Police Academy, Madhuban, Karnal

item.title: Gloves off as Punjab governor, CM Bhagwant Mann slug it out again
item.description: The cold war between Punjab governor Banwarilal Purohit and chief minister Bhagwant Mann escalated on Monday with the former dropping another letter bomb questioning AAP government’s recent decisions. The move drew a sharp response from Mann who said his government is only answerable to Punjabis and not a Centre-appointed governor.

item.title: Semi-decomposed body of teen found, sexual assault suspected
item.description: The room where the body was found was rented to a man who was previously sentenced to 10 years’ rigorous imprisonment in a sexual assault case. The man is currently absconding

item.title: Without salaries for 284 days, say Kashmiri Pandits appointed under PM package
item.description: Scores of Prime Minister package Kashmiri migrant Pandit employees and Jammu-based reserved category employees fled to Jammu in May last year following targeted killings of their colleagues, Rahul Bhat and Rajini Bala, by terrorists in the valley.

item.title: Hoardings showcase UP’s religious, tourist destinations before G20 guests
item.description: These hoardings are part of the government plan to hard sell UP as an investment destination before the visitors from abroad.

item.title: A woman can be prosecuted for gang rape: HC
item.description: Elaborating the provisions of IPC sections 375 and 376 related to the offence of rape (amended in 2013), Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav rejected the plea that a woman cannot be prosecuted for the alleged commission of the offence of gang rape

item.title: This GITA uses AI to solve life issues!
item.description: Seeking solution to life problems?Welcome then to modern GITA guidance, one that uses artificial intelligence

item.title: DU launches admissions site, announces criteria for CUET
item.description: The CUET UG exam registration is currently underway and will continue till March 12. The exam will be conducted between May 21 and May 31 in 13 major languages in the computer-based test mode

item.title: One-way ticket to Iran led to arrest of terror suspect in city: Official
item.description: The official said that the suspect, identified as Mohammed Arif, a software engineer, had applied for a visa to the Iranian Embassy as part of his plan to enter Afghanistan to join Al-Qaeda in March. The suspicion raised by the Iranian official led NIA and local police to the suspect, the official added.

item.title: Man arrested for raping, killing 8-year-old girl in Haryana’s Hisar
item.description: Hisar police have arrested a man for allegedly killing an eight-year-old girl after raping her

item.title: Can’t have gag orders on drives like #BoycottBollywood: Anurag Thakur
item.description: Thakur was in Chembur as part of the Lok Sabha Pravas scheme rolled out to achieve 45 Lok Sabha seats from Maharashtra.

item.title: Rohtak court to pronounce verdict in 1997 Rohtak bomb blast case on February 15
item.description: A local court in Rohtak on Monday completed the hearing in a case against Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Syed Abdul Karim alias Tunda, in connection with his alleged role in bomb blasts at Quila Road and vegetable market here in 1997

item.title: After dewatering, Haiderpur wetland faces encroachment
item.description: In January, the UP irrigation department drained water from the wetland , leading to tens of thousands of migratory birds deserting the site.

item.title: Govt wants to ensure no section left behind, says President Droupadi Murmu in Lucknow
item.description: President Droupadi Murmu distributes forest rights letters to members of Buxa tribe on the second day of her visit to Lucknow

item.title: INSO chief questions MDU V-C’s credentials, Rajbir Singh denies charges
item.description: MDU vice-chancellor Rajbir Singh categorically denied the charges. “The allegations against me are ‘personal and baseless’,” the V-C said.

item.title: 12-yr-old boy saves little sisters but dies retrieving school bag from burning hut
item.description: A fire which broke out in a hutment on the hillock of forest land in Kurar village, Malad east, soon turned into a level-2 inferno. After at least five gas cylinders exploded in quick succession, it escalated gutting about 100 hutments

item.title: National Conference accuses Apni Party of double-speak over demolition drive
item.description: Says Apni Party is holding protests against the demolition even as the mayor owes allegiance to their party; the NC said this exposes the double speak of the Apni Party, to which the mayor owes allegiance. They said that for the last few days, Apni Party held a series of demonstrations against the demolition and eviction of people during the anti-encroachment drive in J&K.

item.title: Two crocodiles rescued from Haryana’s Kurukshetra village by local divers
item.description: Adult male and female crocodiles were rescued from a drain near Dabkheri village in the Kurukshetra district

item.title: Valentine’s, a day to also celebrate furry friends
item.description: Valentine’s Day can be so much more than an opportunity to celebrate your significant other

item.title: Mustard production expected to touch 14 lakh MT in Haryana
item.description: The procurement of mustard will begin on March 28, while gram procurement will start on April 1 followed by sunflower from June 1 in Haryana

item.title: 7-year-old HIV-positive boy beats thalassemia
item.description: Mumbai: Beating all the odds, including getting HIV infection, a seven-year-old boy has managed to defeat thalassemia major—an inherited blood disorder characterised by decreased haemoglobin production

item.title: Youth Congress protests in Haryana’s Yamunanagar
item.description: Members of the Haryana youth Congress on Monday protested at Yamunanagar’s mini secretariat against the alleged poor implementation of government schemes in the state and its apathy towards rectifying the mistakes

item.title: Eight-month pregnant woman killed for dowry
item.description: Mumbai: A man has been arrested for allegedly killing his eight-month pregnant wife for dowry in Dharavi

item.title: Patra Chawl project: Homebuyers contemplate moving HC after MHADA remains non-committal
item.description: Borikar refused to give clear timelines to the homebuyers from Ekta Tripolis, Kalpataru Radiance and The Luxor projects, stuck without an Occupancy Certificate (OC), as to when they will receive the possession of their homes. They have been waiting for close to 10 years

item.title: 68% government primary schools in Ludhiana yet to enter internet age
item.description: There is no official provision to provide funds to make internet available at government primary schools

item.title: Action on those who let illicit buildings come up: LG’s office
item.description: Officials said they have, till Monday evening, “reclaimed” 4,180.6 square metres of land from Ladha Sarai village, but did not clarify how much encroachments remain

item.title: Uttar Pradesh has used technology to give digital platform to investors: Yogi Adityanath at G20 Digital Economy Working Group meeting in Lucknow
item.description: Digitalising PDS helped Uttar Pradesh save ₹1,200 crore annually, says chief minister Yogi Adityanath at G20 Digital Economy Working Group meeting in Lucknow

item.title: Winds clean up Delhi's air, mercury may rise from Tuesday
item.description: The minimum temperature is forecast to rise to around 12°C by Tuesday. The maximum will continue to rise now and can touch 30°C by Saturday

item.title: In-principle nod for shorter route to airport given to Chandigarh admn: IAF to HC
item.description: Working permission for the shorter route to be granted by Union defence ministry after vetting by Directorate General, Defence Estates, HC told

item.title: Ludhiana salon penalised for failing to honour bridal make-up contract
item.description: Consumer commission directed the Ludhiana salon owner to refund ₹1 lakh to complainant and pay a compensation of ₹10,000

item.title: PAU and GADVASU teachers suspend teaching, research activities
item.description: PAU Teachers Association (PAUTA) and GADVASU teachers association also held a protest in the campus against the delay in adoption of revised pay scales and revision of pensions by the state

item.title: ‘Will PM attending Aero India solve poverty’: HDK slams BJP
item.description: While talking to the media Hubballi, Kumaraswamy said: “Is the Air Show a programme to remove poverty? Will poverty be ended by participating in the Aero India Show? The attempt is being made to misguide people at the time of elections.”

item.title: Dial 112: Navi Mumbai cops launch awareness campaign
item.description: Inaugurating the campaign, #AlertNaviMumbaikar, police commissioner Milind Bharambe said, “Even as the service is available from April 2021, there is little awareness among the people. Hence, we decided to organise a special campaign to spread the knowledge about the existence of such an emergency number

item.title: Shivamogga airport to be named after Kuvempu: BSY
item.description: Yediyurappa said that a unanimous decision would be taken during the ongoing state assembly sessionto finalise the name, which will be recommended to the central government.

item.title: Furious residents stage ‘rasta roko’ over rash driving in Wadala, demand prompt action from police
item.description: Residents of the area said that over the last couple of years, the menace of rash driving, especially by taxi drivers, had increased at an alarming rate and it has been brought to the notice of the local police more than once.

item.title: First EAC meet highlights state’s potential to contribute for $5trillion economy
item.description: Chandrasekharan said India is the fifth largest economy and is well positioned to achieve the highest growth, marching high globally for years to come.

item.title: Teen motorist held for crashing into traffic cop, dragging him along
item.description: Mumbai: A traffic police constable from Vasai had to cling on to the bonnet of a car after the driver jumped a signal and refused to stop, crashed into the official and dragged him along for some distance on Sunday evening

item.title: Hyderabad engineer held for hoax bomb call to Google office in BKC
item.description: As per the police, the accused had called up Google’s BKC office late on Sunday night and said that a bomb had been placed in the tech giant’s Pune office.

item.title: Vindicated, says AAP; We respect court’s view: BJP
item.description: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Monday slammed the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) for adopting “dishonest” means to win mayor polls even as the Supreme Court vindicated the party’s stand that the nominated aldermen cannot be allowed to vote in the MCD House

item.title: Uttar Pradesh gets its first mediation & arbitration centre
item.description: Facility aims to aid government, investors; reduce time taken to enforce contracts and resolve disputes

item.title: 188 tonnes of flowers sent from city this Valentine’s season
item.description: Mumbai: Around 188 tonnes of flowers were sent to various international and domestic destinations in Valentine’s season from the city’s international airport

item.title: Drone seized from Jammu outskirts
item.description: The drone was observed flying on the outskirts of Bandrali village in Bishnah area late on Sunday night, they said. The villagers immediately informed the police when they saw the quadcopter flying over the hamlet.

item.title: FDA launches drive to keep a check on e-pharmacy operations
item.description: After the CDSCO issued show cause notices questioning the legality of e-pharmacies, the Maharashtra FDA has launched an intensified drive to look at the operations of online portals selling medicines. The drive would focus on the processes followed for selling prescription drugs

item.title: Dahanu authority member expresses concerns over Vadhavan Port project
item.description: Mumbai: The Dahanu Taluka Environment Protection Authority (DTEPA) on Monday held its first full-strength hearing since the appointment of its new chairman

item.title: Kashmir’s Good Samaritans collect relief material for quake-hit Turkey, Syria
item.description: Omar Wani, a representative of the organisation, said the response of people was overwhelming. “Everybody saw videos of the earthquake and its aftermath which makes one’s heart cry. Within hours of our appeal, a flood of people came with blankets, sleeping bags etc. There was a traffic jam outside our office. We received three truckloads of material within a day and it is still continuing,” said Wani.

item.title: SC says aldermen cannot vote for mayor as polls postponed
item.description: The court’s observation came on a petition by Shelly Oberoi, AAP’s mayor candidate, and party’s leader of the House Mukesh Goel

item.title: Miscreants rob ₹59,000 cash from two liquor vends in Khanna
item.description: Deputy superintendent of police (DSP, Khanna) William Jeji said that the police are scanning CCTVs to identify the accused. Two separate cases have been lodged against unidentified miscreants

item.title: In Thane, rift between BJP and Shinde-led BSS widens
item.description: Recent complaints by two BJP MLAs—Sanjay Kelkar from Thane and Mihir Kotecha from Mulund—on the projects being pushed by CM Eknath Shinde have raised eyebrows in political circles and are being seen as an indication that not everything is hunky-dory in the BJP-BSS alliance

item.title: Disappointed, say political parties as Supreme Court scraps plea against delimitation
item.description: Almost all political parties are awaiting the first assembly elections post abrogation of Article 370 and bifurcation of J&K into two UTs in J&K. However, the dates have not been given for the elections despite pleas from leaders of different political parties.

item.title: Haryana CM conducts aerial survey of area earmarked for jungle safari site
item.description: Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar and deputy chief minister Dushyant Chautala also held a meeting with the officers of the district administration and forest department and gave necessary directions regarding the marking of the areas

item.title: Doors of Mumbai-Shirdi Vande Bharat get stuck at Thane station
item.description: Transport experts stated that these are short-term problems that occur in the early stages of a new project, which usually continue for a few days and constant training on operating these new-age trains is needed.

item.title: Delhi govt to study its anti-dust measures
item.description: The study will assess the effectiveness of anti-smog guns, water sprinkling tankers and mechanised road sweepers in combating air pollution in the city

item.title: MahaRERA urged to prevent builders from taking advance maintenance charges
item.description: Mumbai: Leading consumer body Mumbai Grahak Panchayat has written a letter to Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) chairperson Ajoy Mehta, seeking directions to promoters to stop collecting advance maintenance charges for one or two years from homebuyers and ensure formation of cooperative housing societies after more than 50% buyers book flats in a project

item.title: Chandigarh: Cold winds cause night temp to drop to 6°C
item.description: This was the lowest night temperature in Chandigarh since January 18 when it was 3.3°C, as per the India Meteorological Department

item.title: Keylong records coldest night of season at -13.2°C
item.description: Kukumseri in the district was second coldest at -12. 1°Celsius. Narkanda, a quaint hill station about 65 kilometres from Shimla, shivered at -4°C, whereas Kalpa in Kinnaur saw a low of 3°C.

item.title: AIR-Prayagraj to launch Kumbhvani station for Mahakumbh
item.description: For this, a separate transmitter will be installed at the Sangam area to broadcast several programmes throughout the day, starting at 5.15 am each day, officials said.

item.title: NDMC to hold tulip festival from February 14
item.description: Lieutenant governor VK Saxena earlier said that over 500,000 tulip bulbs will be planted across the city, including in areas under the Municipal Corporation of Delhi

item.title: Farmers’ union protest seeking release of Sikh prisoners outside Ludhiana DC office
item.description: Union members staged a sit-in protest for two hours outside the mini-secretariat gate and voiced their opposition against both the state and central government

item.title: In Delhi's Mehrauli, it’s bulldozers vs documents
item.description: Officials said that they had so far “reclaimed” 4,180.6 square metres of land in and around the historic south Delhi area

item.title: Chandigarh: SDM office clerk who took ₹2,000 bribe awarded 5-year rigorous imprisonment
item.description: The clerk, Jasbir Singh, was arrested by CBI on June 3, 2015, after being caught red-handed while accepting the bribe from the complainant

item.title: Cong questions govt decision to shut down Visvesvaraya steel plant
item.description: Congress on Monday questioned the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led state government over the decision to close down Visvesvaraya Iron and Steel Plant (VISP) in Bhadravati in Karnataka

item.title: Powai shocker: Couple booked for sexual torture of PhD student
item.description: Mumbai: A student with a leading technology institute in Mumbai has filed a complaint alleging that a couple from Powai subjected him to torture, including sexual acts of a masochistic nature, for over a year

item.title: Talks fail, infra projects in city to be hit as tankers keep away
item.description: Mumbai: Several infrastructure projects in the city are likely to be impacted if the strike called by the Water Tanker Association of Mumbai (WTAM), on February 8, is not resolved soon

item.title: Jamia violence: Delhi HC notice to Sharjeel,others on discharge
item.description: In its plea against the judgement, Delhi Police contended that the trial court was swayed by “emotional and sentimental feelings” while discharging the accused and passed “gravely prejudicial, adverse remarks”

item.title: Snatchers ambush cyclist with sticks, take away wallet in Chandigarh
item.description: The victim was cycling back home around 11.35 pm on Sunday, when the snatchers waylaid him near Kali Mata temple behind Panjab University in Chandigarh

item.title: Lalitha Lajmi - A view into her soul
item.description: Her retrospective opened on 12th January, 2023, exactly a month before her death. It opened because she had dreamed of a befitting recognition for her contribution in Indian Art History as the only woman to have turned the gaze of the muse on herself. Until her, women had only been depicted as nude anatomical studies by male painters

item.title: Zia Mohyedddin (1931 - 2023): A teller of stories like none other
item.description: Zia Mohyeddin was a fastidious man, a fastidious artist, a fastidious teacher and a rasik in the truest sense of the term

item.title: Sarai Kale Khan flyover is 60% complete, says PWD
item.description: The new three-lane Sarai Kale Khan flyover, coming up parallel to the one that exists at the traffic hub, is expected to be finished ahead of its July 2023 deadline, officials of the Public Works Department (PWD) said on Monday

item.title: Nine held for remarks on Ambedkar in skit
item.description: P Krishnakant, deputy commissioner of police (DCP), Bengaluru South, said seven students, the principal and the programme organiser were arrested by the Siddapura police on Monday.

item.title: BEST gets India’s first AC e-double decker bus, to run it on Bandra-Kurla route from this week
item.description: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking on Monday received the country’s first AC electric double decker bus from the manufacturer

item.title: Tibetans-in-exile mark 100th independence day
item.description: Speaking on the occasion, Rinzin Choedon, National Director of SFT-India said Tibetans commemorate the nation’s independent past on February 13 every year for it is a powerful expression of the people’s desire for freedom.

item.title: Tiger kills two, including child, in Coorg
item.description: According to forest officers, the tiger attacked Chetan (12), the son of a migrant labourer at Churikadu in K Badaga village on Sunday at 4 pm. Chetan’s parents migrated from Panchavalli in Hunsur just three months back for a coffee estate owned by N Poonacha. The workers were in the estate when the tiger killed the boy, playing in front of the labourer’s quarters provided by the estate owner, officers added.

item.title: Protests build up against government’s ‘interfaith marriages committee’
item.description: The groups have formed a committee called ‘Salokha Samiti’ (harmony committee) to demand the withdrawal of the interfaith panel. Alleging that the government’s intention was solely to harass people from a particular community, they said the interfaith marriage committee was a precursor to bringing in an anti-conversion law in Maharashtra

item.title: Experts slam K’taka govt’s plan to construct 11 flyovers
item.description: Last week, chief minister Basavaraj Bommai said, “It is for the first time in the history of Bengaluru that 11 flyovers s have been sanctioned in one year. These changes would provide long-lasting solutions to the citizens.”

item.title: Have always toed party line: Thorat
item.description: The development comes days after Satyajeet, who won from the Nashik Graduates’ Constituency as an independent candidate, said he would continue to work as an independent legislator.

item.title: Court rejects Purvi Modi’s plea for ED’s intervention in bankruptcy proceedings against Nirav
item.description: Mumbai: A special Fugitive Economic Offenders (FEO) court on Monday rejected the plea of Purvi Mehta, the sister of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, seeking orders to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to intervene in the bankruptcy proceedings being conducted before a US court against her brother

item.title: MU to have book on mapping Mumbai’s culture and diversity
item.description: Mumbai: So far, many books have been published about Mumbai

item.title: Group of 12 men rob ₹35,000 from grocery store
item.description: The accused vandalised the shop and robbed ₹35,000 in cash. When a passerby Munna Giri tried to raise an alarm, the accused assaulted him and fled leaving him injured

item.title: 8 more industrial sectors to come up in Greater Noida
item.description: The Greater Noida authority signed memorandums of understanding (MoUs) worth ₹90,000 crore with various domestic and international investors

item.title: NGT directs removal of cleaning, removal of encroachment from Sahibabad drain within six months
item.description: Last May, the green court had declared illegal all constructions/encroachments and coverings on the drain bed and a 12 metre buffer zone from the edge of Sahibabad drain in Ghaziabad and directed that these be demolished irrespective of previous permissions given by the Ghaziabad municipal corporation

item.title: BEST to offer a host of incentives to passengers
item.description: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking is introducing a slew of sops for Mumbaiites

item.title: Flagged on social media, RPF arrests two for hurling stones on train
item.description: The complainant said that after he reported the incident, the authorities said that such incidents were “regular”

item.title: Noida slum fire toll now three, more critical
item.description: Rizwan (who goes by one name), 32, was a daily wage labourer and was admitted to Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital after the fire broke out at his home due to a cylinder blast in Noida’s Sector 8 in the early hours of Sunday

item.title: Turkey, Syria earthquake: Prayers go up for victims in Prayagraj mosques
item.description: n all Prayagraj mosques, Imams are praying for them after ‘namaz’. The Imams and Ulemas are also requesting people to provide whatever help they can for the victims of the disaster through proper channels.

item.title: Umesh Kolhe murder: Accused vet seeks bail, claims he is staunch Sunni Muslim, not Tablighi Jamaat member
item.description: Mumbai: Yusuf Khan, a veterinary doctor, one of the accused in the murder of Amravati pharmacist Umesh Kolhe, on Monday moved a bail plea before a NIA court

item.title: German parliamentary delegation visits solar-agri farm at DEI
item.description: The delegation reached the dairy campus of the DEI and inspected the solar-agriculture farm which sets an example of new concept for the integration of solar energy into agriculture.

item.title: 100 eucalyptus trees axed outside Chandigarh secretariat
item.description: The municipal corporation has axed as many as 100 crack-ridden eucalyptus trees outside the UT Secretariat in Sector 9, Chandigarh. A senior MC official said the trees that were around 40 years old were cut down after the UT home secretary’s permission.

item.title: Speeding SUV injures three men in Chaura Bazar
item.description: The accused managed to escape from the spot after the incident leaving their vehicle, Mahindra Thar, behind

item.title: ‘KGMU planning to introduce robotic surgery’
item.description: For speedy recovery of patients, the department of surgery at the King George’s Medical University is planning to introduce robotic surgery, said Prof AA Sonkar, HoD surgery at KGMU while addressing a press conference here on Monday.

item.title: Ludhiana MC to launch drive against garbage dumping in Buddha Nullah
item.description: The decision was taken following a meeting of the Vidhan Sabha committee constituted by the government for the cleaning of the water body, also known as Buddha Nullah at circuit house

item.title: Mobile phone, cache of drugs recovered from inmate in Ludhiana Central Jail
item.description: The jail staff recovered one mobile phone, 10.1 gm opium like paste, 6.5 gm narcotic powder and 24.1 gm brown coloured crystal like matter

item.title: Vigilance bureau glare on official after Gurugram RTA staff, six touts arrested
item.description: Vigilance officials said they received a complaint from a Rewari-based transporter, identified as Surender Singh, over alleged extortion of money by an enforcement team of the Gurugram RTA through touts to allow passing of overloaded vehicles through Gurugram

item.title: Truck driver held with 1.2 quintals of poppy husk on Chandigarh-Hisar road
item.description: The accused truck driver who was held with poppy husk on the Chandigarh-Hisar road was identified as Gurjeet Singh, a resident of Patiala. He was presented before a court and taken into police remand.

item.title: Woman drugged, raped inside car in mall parking lot in Gurugram
item.description: Gurugram A 28-year-old woman was allegedly drugged and raped in the parking lot of a mall in Gurugram’s MG Road, police officers aware of the matter said on Monday

item.title: Hotel bill recovery: Court slams brakes on CITCO’s car auction plan
item.description: For the auction, which was to be held on February 14, CITCO had set the base price of Audi Q3 car at ₹10 lakh, far lower than its original cost of around ₹55 lakh, whereas the Chevrolet Cruze, which cost around ₹15 lakh when bought, was to be auctioned at the base price of ₹1.5 lakh.

item.title: CM Khattar , dy CM conduct aerial inspection of jungle safari site at Aravallis
item.description: The CM and deputy CM were in Gurugram on Sunday for the inauguration of the Sohna-Dausa stretch of the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway and it was during this visit that they conducted the survey of the proposed safari park, said district administration officials

item.title: Religious cities too catch investors’ attention at UPGIS
item.description: Religious cities of the state also attracted investors in the recently concluded Uttar Pradesh Global Investors’ Summit (UPGIS) in Lucknow

item.title: 5 members of a family booked for assaulting cops in Sec 13
item.description: Gurugram: Five members of a family, including two women, were booked for allegedly assaulting police personnel when they tried to tow away a car which the suspects had parked in front of their neighbour’s residence in Sector 13, Gurugram police said on Monday

item.title: Intelligent traffic system to ensure help is just 10 minutes away on Delhi-Mumbai e-way
item.description: The 246km Sohna-Dausa stretch of the expressway was inaugurated on Sunday by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the highway is expected to open to traffic on February 15, said officials. Final touches are being given to the road to ensure that it is absolutely safe for motorists, they said

item.title: Dr Ambedkar is like God to me: President Murmu at BBAU convocation

item.description: The MLA received the screen video recording with the message ‘’Aap bade ijjatdar ho, paise se jyada ijjat pyari hai aapko [you are a respected man, you love respect more than money]’’ in which the fraudster demanded ₹1 lakh

item.title: 2 children, including newborn girl, killed in cylinder blast in Noida slum
item.description: Fire official said that six members of the family were rescued and rushed to the District Hospital in Noida Sector 30, from where they were referred to Safdarjung Hospital in Delhi

item.title: Delhi Police teams up with Truecaller to thwart cyber frauds
item.description: The Delhi Police is all set to sign an MoU with caller ID verification platform Truecaller to help the public identify verified numbers and protect themselves from cyber frauds and scams relating to impersonation in the name of government officials.

item.title: Dehradun: Cops drop attempt to murder charges against 13 held during protest
item.description: Two FIRs, which included charges like rioting, and attempt to murder, were registered against 39 youths by Dehradun police on Thursday late night for alleged stone pelting and violence during the protest by thousands of unemployed youth

item.title: At Jharkhand rally, Kharge raises Adani to attack PM
item.description: Accusing the BJP government of subverting democracy, Kharge said the portion of his speech as well as of Rahul Gandhi were expunged though they simply raised issues plaguing the country

item.title: Rajasthan opposition leader Gulab Chand Kataria appointed as Assam governor
item.description: The 79-year-old Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader has served as a member of the Rajasthan Legislative Assembly for eight times

item.title: Three arrested for mugging Navy officer in Goa
item.description: According to Satish Padwalkar, police inspector in charge, Old Goa, they received a complaint from Molleti Apparao, 47, an officer with the Indian Navy

item.title: Aero India 2023: Five things to know about this biennial show in Bengaluru
item.description: The five-day air which is drawing global attention will end on February 17.

item.title: Two police personnel, deployed as bodyguards, killed in shoot-out in Jharkhand
item.description: The two Jharkhand police personnel were deployed as the bodyguards of a local fish trader and they were killed in an attack on the businessman's house by his rivals

item.title: Water in 29% wells in Punjab has uranium concentration
item.description: Punjab is the worst affected state in India where 29% of the wells have been observed to have uranium concentration more than the limit of 30 parts per billion, reveals the Groundwater yearbook 2021-22.

item.title: Former Rajasthan minister Gulab Chand Kataria is Assam's new governor
item.description: The senior BJP leader will succeed Jagdish Mukhi in the top post.

item.title: Delhi mayor elections to take place on February 16 after 3 failed attempts
item.description: LG VK Saxena has accepted the AAP government's proposed date of February 16 for the next session of the MCD House which will make the 4th attempt to elect the mayor.
